      • checkRequest

        public void checkRequest(Object req,
                         BiConsumer<Object,Boolean> fn)
        Server request verification function, that checks for allowed origins
        Parameters:
        req - The http.IncomingMessage request
        fn - The callback to be called. It should take one parameter, err, which will be null if there was no problem, and one parameter, success, of type boolean

        Gets whether we're serving the client.js file or not

        Parameters:
        v - True if we want to serve the file, false otherwise

        public Namespace on(StringTypes.connection event,
                    Consumer<Socket> listener)
        The event fired when we get a new connection
        Parameters:
        event - The event being fired: 'connection'
        listener - A listener that should take one parameter of type Socket
        Returns:
        The default '/' Namespace

      • on

                    Consumer<Socket> listener)
        See Also:

      • on

        public Namespace on(String event,
                    def.js.Function listener)
        Base 'on' method to add a listener for an event
        Parameters:
        event - The event that we want to add a listener for
        listener - The callback to call when we get the event. The parameters for the callback depend on the event
        Returns:
        The default '/' Namespace

      • to

        public Namespace to(String room)
        Targets a room when emitting to the default '/' Namespace
        Parameters:
        room - The name of the room that we're targeting
        Returns:
        The default '/' Namespace

      • in

        public Namespace in(String room)
        See Also:
        to( room )

      • use

        public Namespace use(BiConsumer<Socket,Consumer<Object>> fn)
        Registers a middleware function, which is a function that gets executed for every incoming Socket, on the default '/' Namespace
        Parameters:
        fn - The function to call when we get a new incoming socket. It should take one parameter of type Socket, and one callback function to call to execute the next middleware function. The callback can take one optional parameter, err, if there was an error. Errors passed to middleware callbacks are sent as special 'error' packets to clients
        Returns:
        The default '/' Namespace

      • emit

        public Namespace emit(String event,
                      Object... args)
        Emits an event to the default Namespace
        Parameters:
        event - The event that we want to emit
        args - Any number of optional arguments to pass with the event. If the last argument is a function, it will be called as an ack. The ack should take whatever data was sent with the packet
        Returns:
        The default '/' Namespace

      • send

        public Namespace send(Object... args)
        Sends a 'message' event
        Returns:
        The default '/' Namespace
        See Also:
        emit( event, ...args )

      • write

        public Namespace write(Object... args)
